content.description: The right side route on the south face of Jabba. You can either start near Pod Racer and traverse right to clip the first bolt of Skywalker, or you can start directly below in the recess and climb up the crack system to reach the first bolt. If you start down low, you may want a piece of gear between .5" to 2".
content.protection: Bolts and optional cam for the direct start. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Right side route on the south face.  When approaching from the east side of Jabba, tunnel underneath the left side and you will pop out directly below the south face.

content.description: Step across to a boulder with a big flake, clip two bolts and gain a ledge. Then pull onto a higher formation for steep moves for three more bolts.
content.protection: 5 bolts, quicklinks anchor. Extend over the edge for TR
content.location: To the right of Hans Solo on a separate formation

climbs.name: Lunar Ascent
climbs.fa: KC Lunetta, Sarah Lunetta, Reed Ames

content.description: Fun and easy sport climb on nice patina plates. Middle route on the south face of Jabba. Start near Pod Racer and climb up to the ledge on the right to reach the first bolt. You can also clip the first bolt of Pod Racer to protect the first little move onto the ledge.
content.location: Middle route on the south face of Jabba.

content.description: Located a few feet to the right of Jabba. Fun and steep face climbing with good edges.  Balancy crux near the top.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor near the top. Shares anchor with Jabba.
content.location: On the east face of Jabba

content.description: Follow the left trending crack past some gear placements and then climb the steep arete past 3 bolts.  Anchor is at the top of the formation. Its best to belay the second from the anchor and then rappel down, or if you want to top-rope then bring long slings/cordelette and expect some rope drag.
content.protection: Small Cam .4"-.75" at the bottom, and 3 bolts.
content.location: East face of Jabba.  Rappel down.

content.description:
For many years this route only had the bottom two bolts and it was basically a solo from there. Hence the name Hans Solo. The rest of the bolts and a new anchor were added in 2014 to make it a fun and well protected 5.6 sport route.

Starts up on the boulder 10 feet right of Leia. Clip the first bolt and then step across onto the wall.
content.protection: Stem across the gap to gain the heavily varnished face. Climb the patina past five bolts and two bolt anchor with Mussy Hooks. Lower off.
content.location: 10 feet up and right of Leia. The only bolted line on the north face of Jabba.

climbs.name: Droid Rage
climbs.fa: Chris Asencio, as far as I know

content.description: A large slabby arete that starts on crimps to a hand crack, then to a slabby last 15ft. Fun but very high. Top out just right of the bush
content.location: Scramble left of the 5.8 with fixed cam, itll be just aroind the corner.

content.description: From the bench placed in front of the Jabba formation , face the bench, jump! Grabbing the lip of the overhang, mantle it and top out directly over the bench
content.location: Directly above the bench infront of "Jabba"

climbs.name: A Day At The Pod Races

content.description: Clip a low first bolt and pull up on jugs.  Continue up and left clipping closely spaced bolts.
content.location:
Located on the left arete of

Jabba

.
